resources.string:
Regreening africa app

 Regreening Africa App is a mobile-based android application that helps users to collect information(Tree planting, nurseries and FMNR) on how farmers are managing and protecting trees on their farms.

 This application was developed under World Agroforestry Centre(ICRAF) Regreening Africa project, a project that targets to reverse land degradation in Africa by scaling up evergreen agriculture.
Developers\n Benard Onkware, Muhammad Ahmad & Tor Vagen.\n
Icons\n The icons used were downloaded from https://thenounproject.com/ .\n

For data Collection
 Follow the following steps;
 1) To start collecting data, Click on the Start button
 2) Select the type of survey you want to collect data on from one of the buttons
 3) Fill in the data, use NEXT or PREV for navigation through the screens.

For sending completed data
 Follow this steps;
 1) Connect your device to the internet
 2) Click on Send completed data and select the completed filled data from one of the buttons
 3) Completed data will always show the number of records to be sent

Technical terms
 Local seed dealer-Seed dealer close to the farm
 Internal boundary-boundaries inside the plot
 External boundary-plots boundary
 Fallow/bushland-land ploughed and harrowed but left for a period without sown in to restore its fertility
 Woodlot-woodland or forest in small scale production of wood
 Home garden-Subsistence food production on the land next to the headfarm
 Cohort-Trees of the same species planted in the same rainy season
 Marcotting also known as air layering is a type of plant propagation that involves rooting of part of a stem while it is still attached to the parent plant
